title: Make ByteNegMutator negate, not flip
body:
Change the ByteNegMutator to negate a byte, not flip it. Flipping a byte is already implemented in ByteFlipMutator.

See issue: https://github.com/AFLplusplus/LibAFL/issues/674

title: New hooks for libafl_qemu
body: The new hook system will allow multiple generation hooks (translation time). This will open the window to generation hooks that analyze the code and insert generic hooks to single instruction, for instance for call stack tracking.

title: CustomBuf Events to exchange any data between fuzzers
body: Be careful: Messages on LLMP never get freed (currently), use sparingly.

title: Add custom GDB commands to libafl_qemu
body: The use case is to allow a frontend fuzzer to expose commands such as `monitor input-location 0xababcafe 42` and `monitor start-fuzzing` to avoid to write an harness and fuzz from GDB connected to qemu user.

title: Apple aarch64 fixes
body:
The `libc` crate is potentially broken, see https://github.com/rust-lang/libc/issues/2812 leading to a segfault.
Also, aarch64 macOS doesn't support core affinity on a kernel level, so we ignore it, instead of crashing.

(or should we report this error and leave it up to the user? cc @andreafioraldi )

title: Fix overflow on debug build
body:
Closes #631

@s1341 
I had to remove #[clap(short)] on `cmplog_cores` and `cores` because they use the option '-c', but `configuration` also uses '-c', and thus, it fails to build on debug build.
```
The application panicked (crashed).
Message:  Command libafl: Short option names must be unique for each argument, but '-c' is in use by both 'configuration' and 'cmplog-cores'
Location: /home/toka/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/clap-3.1.8/src/build/debug_asserts.rs:100
```


Same for `asan_cores` and `REMOTE`, and I removed #[clap(short)] from `asan_cores`

title: Fixes forkersever_simple issue on Macs
body:
Fixes #611, an issue where `StdShMemProvider` does not work properly on Macs with targets compiled with `afl-cc`.

Since that particular combination seems to not be used frequently, I fixed the issue by using `UnixShMemProvider` in `forkserver_simple` and `backtrace_baby_fuzzers/forkserver_executor`, controlled by a cfg

One issue I ran into is that `ForkserverExecutorBuilder` only implemented `autotokens` and `parse_afl_cmdline` when ForkserverExecutorBuilder used a `StdShMemProvider` as its generic type (idk if my wording here is proper). All I did was change which impl block those two functions were put in.

title: Backtrace in libafl::Error
body:
#571 

errors_backtrace is the feature to use it, disabled by default

title: Fix gnf_converter.py script
body:
This script fixes several issues in `gnf_converter.py` script. 

1) The `terminal_exist` should check if the terminal is the only element in the rule. 
- This function should only return the `nonterminal` if the terminal is the only element in the rule. For example the rule `'B'=["'a'", "'b'"]` should not be considered. 
- The original implementation modifies the semantics of the language and the transformation is unsound.
2) Remove left recursions in GNF
- This is required otherwise the GNF function may never terminate
3) Remove `break_rules` function
- This function seems unnecessary because the GNF function will merge those rules back. 
4) Replace terminals except for the first element in  `remove_mixed` function.
- This is an optimization because the `gnf` function will replace non-terminals with terminals for the first token.

I don't see any unit test implemented for this script but I provided a simple grammar file to test the functionalities.

title: Use ucontext from bolts::os::unix_signals for armv7 support
body:
This commit modifies the imports of `ucontext_t` in inprocess.rs to use the local definitions in **bolts::os::unix_signals**.
Here, we added custom structs for armv7, as the libc crate for this arch does not feature a `ucontext_t` definition.

title: Sender id fix
body:
After the first restart, the sender was no longer set.
This PR re-reads the correct sender from the initialized page.
The sender data is now redundant in an env and the page, I guess this could be cleaned up further in the future.

Autotokens New PM
body: also changed clang.rs to load passes that were built using new PM

title: Call post_exec_all() in calibrate.rs
body:
use reset_map() , not pre_exec_all() in calibration stage.

I originally thought that post_exec_all() is missing from calibration stage, but adding the post_exec_all() would cost additional cost
What we want is resetting the map every time before running the harness, so I change it to call to reset_map() instead of pre_exec_all()

title: Dump Control Flow Graph in AFLCoverage LLVM Pass
body:
I am trying to implement PANGOLIN, AFLGo, DigFuzz, etc. in LibAFL, which all needs control flow graph info. This PR adds code to AFLCoverage pass to dump the CFG into a readable file and to libafl_cc to parse such file. 

For libpng, such dump file is ~700KB and parsing it takes <0.1s.
